caption: Field Trip is a fast casual restaurant. It is definitely on the healthier side among other eateries in this part of Harlem. I realized when I walked in that it would of have been better to preorder my food via their website because it was such a long wait and there weren't that many customers online. I know, I know COVID precautions. The 2 servers were doing their best  to fill incoming orders from online & in person but they were slow. Let me tell there is not one hint of attitude from these ladies (how rare is that in a Harlem restaurant). That earns a 2 star rating in itself.  One person came in after I did after about 3 minutes, she turned around and left. I finally place my order for the chicken bowl and the fried fish bowl.  It took a while to prepare but finally the server walked over to the area where I waiting to hand off my order.  I tried the Fried fish bowl first, the fish was packed in a sleeve away from the food (I guess to keep it from being soggy). I added to the bowl and reheated my meal in the microwave. The fish is seasoned a bit too heavy for my taste buds (I don't consume alot of salt). I didn't care for the cornmeal batter either, it was a bit gritty. The rice was good, well cooked but it had some veggies in there I don't eat like brussel sprouts. Brussel sprouts are not common vegetables in my Caribbean/Southern upbringing but I did it  eat it (not too bad). *shrugs* Overall, I wouldn't order the fish again (the seasoning/batter).  I will try the chicken bowl tonight. The restaurant is a medium sized clean and modern space but obviously no is dining in. I would definitely go back to order (pre-order) the veggie bowl and maybe try something else on the menu.

I wanted to try this place for a long time.  I was finally able to try it a couple of days ago.  I had a hard choice between the different type of bowls.  I settled on the salmon black rice bowl.  Initially, I thought the bowls were on the small side but I soon changed my opinion.  It was heavy and packed right.  Salmon cooked perfect and not overcooked or dry.  I will definitely come back and probably try the shrimp green curry bowl next.
Good food and even better people
Really good food.
Overrated underplated

I love this place but wish it was more consistent. When I order the fried cod sometimes it taste delicious as if someone’s marinated it and other times it’s dry and tasteless. I also have gotten several bowls with the rice was not completely cooked. Veggies are also sometimes under done and under seasoned.

Found out about this black owned restaurant from the NYC takeout restaurant week promos.  It was so worth the trip to Harlem as the food and staff were amazing! I ordered the crispy chicken bowl, bbq brisket bowl and hot honey sweet plantains. It was so flavorful! The portions are bit small so I recommend ordering sides with your bowl.  Also, the decor is super cute and perfect for selfies.

I liked it! I got the chicken bowl and the yucca chips. The yucca chips were not what I was expecting at all. A somewhat savory and sweet taste. I thought the yucca chips would be like yucca fries but that’s alright. The chicken bowl was good albeit the greens were a lot. Next time I will try another bowl or potentially customize if they let me. Really great customer service!!
Would certainly recommend trying out this place. Exceptional character, fresh dishes, excellent customer service. Fantastic work.

The food was not good when we went. The fried rice just hard rice with lots of vegetables.My chicken was was okay, Brussels sprouts were over cooked. My moms brisket was dry and her rice was also hard she said “it was like chewing pebbles.”They seemed to get angry when we asked for more honey on the plantains. The best thing about this place was the friendly nice cashier. He seemed like he wanted to be there, not the chefs.
I love this place. They have a creative menu, delicious food packed with flavor and yet at the same time healthy and affordable.

The staff was friendly. The Dragonfruit Lemonade is good. I was expecting something different with the food. It is definitely different, not something I am use to. I am sure the food is healthy, and it may taste good to other people, but I didn't enjoy it all at. Good luck overall.

Rice is life. The balance of rice, vegetable and protein in each dish is so lovingly curated. The flavors are amazing. The menu is tight and you’ll find something you love easily. Don’t over order so you have an excuse to come back.
Delicious rice bowls and friendly staff! One of Harlem's best.
Healthy, hearty, delicious rice bowls. Delivery doesn’t jeopardize the integrity if the food. I could eat here everyday because they have options, flavors and the staff is friendly.
(Translated by Google) Excellent place  (Original) Excelente place

Walked by a few times but never went in. Saw the owner on the Wendy Williams show and decided to try it out. I ordered the Shrimp Bowl. It was delicious! Every element worked well and all of it was cooked to perfection. I also had the Crab Pockets, another WIN! Yummy 🤤 additional to my original. Went back again and ordered the chicken bowl! Another WIN!
Great food and quick service!
Absolutely amazing!

FIELDTRIP'S Food is amazing. Their customer service is great and their commitment to supporting our community residents dealing with food insecurities during the pandemic has been outstanding and will always be remembered.
Always great customer service. Really felt like home cooking and healthy.

OMG. I'm 3 months in to transitioning to plant based eating to reduce my risk developing preventable diseases. That said, it's hard to be a nutritarian  (non dairy / non meat) eater with so little choices for delicious plant based foods, until I  stumbled into Field Trip and ordered the kale & broccoli rice bowl.  The 1st bite made me sing and dance. Thanks guys see you next trip
They have this ginger drink called sorel that I've never tried. It's super good!! I also had a beef bowl and that was delicious. Plus, super friendly service. What a nice lady!
Always delicious!
Pretty good though felt it was a hair expensive for this area
I love this place! All of their meals are healthy and well portioned. It's my favorite lunch spot in the neighborhood!

I liked the shrimp a lot. But i dont know what happened to my rice, it was genuinely the consistency of oatmeal. You could barely notice seperate grains of rice :( this sucks cause i really wanted to splurge(i dont usually eat out) after a good day.
Food is fantastic and comes fast. Perfect for getting a filling meal when you're on the go

All I gotta say is where had this restaurant been all my life?! The yummiest and most savory food I’ve had in a long time! I ate the naan in like 30 seconds and devoured the salmon bowl as well. The salmon bowl was amazing with so many different flavors and a balance of savory, sweet, salty, and bitterness of the roasted Brussels sprouts. WOW! I can’t wait to go back.

The nan bread was really the star I had it with avocado sauce it was amazing. The fried chicken bowl was ok i did not like that it was covered in ketchup or at least that’s what the sauce tasted like. The salmon bowl was a different taste I didn’t expect and I actually liked it there was pineapple  in the rice which was black rice and the pairing of the sauce of the salmon really brought it all together.

Saw this place reviewed on a TV NEWS segment. The food offerings were more memorable than the name, so we dropped in. The menu was inviting and the taste was right on. Shrimp Gumbo was stellar as was the Salmon Bowl. The other offerings have potential for the next visit. Everything was flavorful, except the decor. Take out works because you're only 3 blocks from Central Park.

I should edit my review, especially since Fieldtrip (owner) responded so graciously to my lazy review (just the rating). Absolutely 100% worth the visit, will return for other bowls since they all looked SO delicious. My veggie bowl was 11/10, full of flavor and once again proving that if you treat ingredients with respect and care, they will shine. Thank you for a great experience.

Came in to pick up lunch today and per usual I couldn’t decide between the chicken or the gumbo. The ever helpful folks behind the plexi suggested I get the chicken and a small gumbo on the side! So glad I did. The chicken is a staple. Yummy. I just tore into that gumbo at :642pm and It’s outstanding! So damn good! 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾
Good tasty food. The Nana's Bread is very delicious and served warm!

Shrimp bowl is yummy. The sticky rice is sooo good. The plantains on the side are great as well—sweet and tender on the first bite, but tangy as you chew them. My veggie bowl was disappointing though. They forgot to give me the coconut yogurt dressing, and I didn’t notice until I had left to eat in the park. The broccoli was a bit salty and undercooked. Overall, the food was good—I’ve heard amazing things about the salmon bowl, and I will definitely be coming back to try more.

Huge fan of FIELDTRIP! The staff is incredibly kind and friendly and the food is amazing. I wish I could comment on more menu items but I always get the salmon bowl because it is amazing!!! The Yucca fries and the crab app are also delicious. I haven't had any of the drinks yet, but the rice cream dessert was also amazing. Go, now!
Delicious fresh food. Gumbo had lots of seafood and perfectly spiced. Husband had the salmon - he loved it!
The food is a little pricey but worth it. A welcomed variety and change from the usual Chinese, hambuger joints in the neighborhood.  Delicious and healthy.  The staff is pleasant.
Super tasty!!! New favorite 🥰
The crispy chicken bowl was delicious and the people were nice. All you need for a quick lunch.
ChefJJ does it again. Fieldtrip has amazing healthy food. the salmon and black rice is insane.

Local business that was worth getting caught in the rain. They accommodate for allergies and preferences easily right from their online ordering.  Even if you have a light appetite you HAVE to try the Yuca Chips (tastes like chicharron without all the fat), The Nana bread and the Quinoa Bao Buns (can't live without them now). Its my new weekly favorite! For those who can't device, they have half bowls so you can sample multiple types. Order a Rice Milk Dessert and stick it in the freezer for another time--its more delicious than soft serve and perfectly light for these hot summer days coming up!

Love this place! We travel from Queens to support this amazing black owned business. We have been fans of Chef JJ since he did a residency at Chefs Club NYC. The food at Field Trip taste great and is good quality. The flavors are unique and the price is shockingly reasonable.  We love the meats and fish, greens and black rice.! Also the sides such as plantains and nana's bread are yummy. It is all delicious!

Great restaurant, the food is always delicious and they care about delivering quality customer service. The staff and owner follow up and work to fix any mistakes or less than desirable experiences you may have had.  (original) Ordered from seamless 5 times. Order canceled by seamless twice, never arrived once, incorrect order once and one time my food arrived correctly and on time. Great restaurant that I really wanted to support but terrible delivery service.

The owner of this establishment is a stand up guy. If you've never been to harlem this would be a good place to grab a quick bite. The staff makes you feel welcome and it's nice to be served by a diverse crew who represent NYC. GOD BLESS
Not very flavorful and overpriced for rice

Took a quick trip into the city for lunch. What can I say, food and service was outstanding,  we had the crispy chicken and  shrimp bowl, quinoa bao buns and small crab pockets. Food did not disappoint  will definitely add to my favorites.  Thanks

Customer service so polite and friendly.  On mother's day I got The Field Trip bag and sample of ice milk made with their own recipe.  The food was great.  I got a beef bowl.  I highly recommend this eatery.

Kudos to the chefs (JJ and Nancy) and their team for preparing flavorful, healthy and colorful meals during this challenging times. We ordered meals for our building staff for a week and this was their favorite was food. When given a choice the staff preferred the delicious meals from Field Trip.
Have eaten here several times. Chicken bowl, brisket bowl, veggie bowl. The food is excellent, and even if it's slightly expensive for the area, it is worth it for sure.
There are so many textures and flavors in every bowl. It's a culinary taste adventure.
Food is delicious especially if you dine in. Hearty and delicious. Great for takeaway, if you plan on eating right away. Best when freshly prepared.  Absolutely recommend.
First time here the food was amazing. Harlem has a lot of gems & this is one. I had to get a bowl to go it was that good.
Modern clean tasty love  all of the bowl  as they nourishment with less guilt
Well if you like spicy this is the place to go Gumbo's pretty decent

Fast casual place in the South Harlem. Perhaps too casual and not so fast.  The place is narrow hall, like rail road style with counter at one side and seating on the other. You might have find a pile with water and half-spoon half fork cutlery. Place is decorated with low quality pictures of Harlem and “Rice is Culture” slogan. Might be.  Some items might be sold out at evening time, but overall the seafood gumbo was not even a soup, just a extremely thick substation with rice and shrimps. New Orleans would be cry now.
Great vegan options but several meat options.
Please  return to the US OPEN FOOD court in 2020!
Elevated, ingredient-focused counter-serve at a very reasonable price! Basically my ideal lunch spot.

Dope spot! I try to only eat black owned restaurants so this will be a new weekly visit for me. The food was filling and we weren't left with that groggy feeling. The ingredients selected were amazing. I highly recommend!
So delicious! What an amazing add to the neighborhood. International flavors done really well. Great for lunch or quick dinner!
Interesting multi-cultural cuisine. Courteous, clean and reasonably fast. Not exactly over priced with small portions. Impresivly Earth conscious with paper straws and other recyclables!
A bit too spicy where I didn't expect it but overall decent for a quick meal.
Great customer service, good food! Greens were a little salty and the fish portion was a little small but all the recommended items were delicious

I thoroughly enjoyed everything about this place. Kiara (I think that's her name) was welcoming and helpful with making sure that my veggie bowl was vegan. The actual meal was delicious! I got a curry sauce on the side to add to my bowl and that took it over the top for me. I am looking forward to going back in the very near future.
Everything was amazing.  Food, place and the staff. They made our food for order so it took a bit longer but it was worth it 100 %
Delicious, flavorful, healthy food served by courteous personnel in a clean environment.

This place has unrelized potential. They are often out of their most popular dishes. The staff seems surprised rather than welcoming when customers arrive. The outdoor signage is unclear.  If they can get it together with service and their supplies this could be a nice addition to the neighborhood.
The Food was on point and delicious. The dessert was 😋🤤
Dragon fruit lemonade was so refreshing. Their coconut shrimp and black rice dishes are scrumptious!
OMG. Just had my first brisket bowl - won't be my last. Can't wait to try the gumbo. Healthy and flavorful menu.
Gumbo was great.
Love this place, food is fresh and delicious. I wish the meat portions were a little bit more but I still very much so enjoy this spot.
Clean, pleasant atmosphere, nice music, courteous servers, and of course unusually interesting tasty food
Excellent customer service, food hot,fresh and delicious.

Best fast casual experience in the city. Don't have to take my word for it. Ask the Times. Elevated Pan-African grain bowl-focused fare by young celebrity chef and James Beard award winner, JJ Johnson --- who you can catch cooking there, if you're a regular. High quality, specially-sourced food by a culinary hero for $12? Yes, please. A no-brainer. Why have you not eaten here, yet? (Have the salmon bowl).
Every dish is amazing- the combination of flavors and textures with delicious rice choices are unique and spectacular. Visiting this place is an absolute must when looking for food in Harlem.

I wanted to love this place since I’m looking for delicious and healthy fast casual food in Harlem, but we did not like our food last night. We ordered the crispy chicken and the veggie bowl. The broccoli in the veggie bowl was overly microwaved, mushy and tasteless. The rice was dry. The sauce in the chicken bowl was too thick and too salty. Again, the chicken seemed overly microwaved. So disappointed
I had the salmon bowl with china clack rice - incredible and its my birthday so this was exactly what I needed.

This place has the feel of a fast casual spot you'd find in midtown but it's independent and Harlem owned. Their coconut shrimp bowls are incredibly good. Let's keep these guys open and support local biz!

First time eating here thought I'd give it a try since I live near by. I was very impressed with comp, very disappointed with food preparation. The rice looked like it mashed potatoes 🤔    I  ordered the shrimp bowel is that what it's  SURPOSE to look like? And should I go back?
Amazing place very reasonable price excellent service highly recommended
Food is very appealing to the eyes...

Delicious and affordable, so glad this is in the neighborhood! I was a huge fan of The Cecil when Chef JJ worked there and have missed eating his delicious food since he left the restaurant. Lucky for me (and everyone else) he's back! I stopped in to Field Trip today for a veggie bowl, it was so fresh and flavorful! Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

Excited that this spot is near my house. Had dinner w/ my BF for the 2nd time at Fieldtrip. The Veggie Bowl was oh so delicious & ALL the vegetables were fresh! The bowl included a sause that was very different but had such a tasty twist to it. I also had the crab pockets & those were absolutely delicious as well. Shea the cook <probably spelling her name wrong> is super pleasant & took great care of us. Thank you Shea!!! Chef JJ thank you so much for ALL you do in our Harlem community! I'm so thrilled you're down the block from my home where I've been a resident of Harlem for 30 years! Thankful & grateful 🤟💙❤💜🦄
Yummy rice dishes!

I had my favorite among Fieldtrip's dishes, the Salmon and Black Rice (it comes with pineapple edamame and piri piri sauce), and the crab pockets as appetizer.  The Black Rice ("China Black Rice") was new to me; it's delicious, especially when their chef combines it with the salmon, edamame and piri piri sauce. The various textures and flavors make for a hearty symphony.  I have been there quite a few times, and always leave satisfied.  I liked their chicken, shrimp and beef offerings as well, but, if available, I stick to the salmon dish.  The food is healthy, the staff is friendly, and you get good wholesome nourishment for your money.

Great experience, quick order we had the shrimp with green curry bowls and they were very  flavorful and fresh.  It is a cafeteria style restraint, order at the counter and find a seat. You should def get the crab puffs they were reaaaly good.

(Translated by Google) I went especially to Harlem for this place. It was quite disappointing. I ordered a bowl of crispy chicken with rice and some crab pockets. The chicken was very bathed in bbq and did not have a minimum of crunch. The rice and vegetables that accompanied were good, but everything tasted like bbq. The crab pockets ... very rich the filling and very bad frying. Very little gold and with a lot of extra oil. The girl treated me well but she looked very overwhelmed with orders (?). There were 5 people in total at the place and it was not rush hour (16:30 on a Saturday).  (Original) Fui especialmente hasta Harlem por este lugar. Fue bastante decepcionante. Pedí un bowl de crispy chicken con arroz y unos crab pockets. El pollo estaba muy bañado en bbq y no tenía un mínimo de crocante. El arroz y las verduras que acompañaban estaban bien, pero todo tenía sabor a la bbq. Los crab pockets...muy rico el relleno y malísima la fritura. Muy poco dorados y con mucho aceite extra. La chica me atendió bien pero se la veía muy sobrepasada con pedidos(?). Éramos 5 personas en total en el local y no era hora pico(16:30 de un sábado).

Eat here! We got the shrimp, braised beef, fried fish, and jerk chicken bowls, and all of them were great. In general, I’m a little wary of “globally inspired” food, but I found all the bowls to be pretty faithful with the cultures they were inspired by. They were not necessarily pitch-perfectly matching a traditional dish, but definitely providing an honest take, and not caricaturing.  The fried fish with homemade tartar sauce was definitely a highlight: crispy, soft, and tangy. The shrimp was well-seasoned and tender, as was the beef. I wasn’t as enthusiastic about the jerk chicken sauce, but it wasn’t bad.  Of course, all the rice was perfectly cooked, soft without being mushy, a flavorful addition to the meal in its own right and not just a plain canvas. And the greens! Somehow, all the brussels sprouts were crispy, the pieces of broccoli cooked through but still crunchy, and the collard greens stewed until soft.  Of the sides, I enjoyed the quinoa bun bao the most. Usually, I think vegetarian versions of meat dishes are only pale imitations, but these buns were little punchy celebrations of flavor that made me not miss having meat at all.  This is food any restaurant should be proud to serve, done in a friendly, fast-casual setting.

Really enjoy the energy in this place. Nice to sit down and eat some delicious food while doing some homework :) .Music is lit , The staff is so friendly & knowledgable about everything on the menu and is  willing to educate anyone with questions. As soon as you walk in the welcoming embrace puts a smile on your face :) my Favoriteeeeee thing on the menu is the crab pockets, ( that’s made with real crab meat ) which was surprising to find in this area, and Also the Rose Sangria on tap , & Dragonfruit lemonade which they make themselves :o !  Really a nice spacious spot that you can either eat & chill with some friends or get some homework done and listen to their fun playlist  , I love it here, see you next trip ! :)

The restaurant is super new and clean. Both counter and seating area is big. Very comfortable!  Shrimp (GF) Sticky rice, toasted coconut, green curry sauce -fresh shrimp, and sticky rice was little sweet with coconut flavor. Very similar to Thai's mango sticky rice. But green curry version. And lots of vegetables  as well!  Salmon (GF) (DF) China black rice, pineapple edamame, piri piri sauce - salmon was very tender and soft. I was surprised they use black rice. It gave more texture. And lots of vegetables in the bowl as well! Feel healthy:)  Yucca puff (GF) (V) - vegetarian version of shrimp cracker. It's my first time had yucca puff! I love it. Very crispy, with hint of sweet and salt. Yummmmy  Crab pockets (SFA) Garlic herbed cream cheese, sweet & sour sauce - crispy skin outside, and full of crab meat inside, with cream cheese.  Dragonfruit lemonade - super refreshing!
Food is great staff is polite  quick service

Excellent flavors and service. We had the crispy chicken, the salmon, the shrimp and the steak bowls. My favorite was the chicken but all of them were really good. The kids also had the dragon fruit lemonade and rice cakes, as well as the ice cream. Overall an excellent experience and a great choice to eat in Harlem.
The perfect place for a rice bowl in Harlem. An option for every diet person. A Must try is the quinoa bao buns, nana's bread and ice cream!
Food is good but pricey!
Really tasty rice bowls- esp the braised beef!  Would love to see more options added to the menu - like salads or califlower rice or a pork (carnitas maybe) option.
Delicious food. I ate the ice cream first and took the salmon bowl (kid size) home for later and it was very tasty. Thrilled to have this as an option in my neighborhood.
Great food. Quick and friendly service. Nice to see places like this moving into the neighborhood!

This place is a welcome addition to the neighborhood! Great food served with warm, quick service - highly recommend. Had the chicken bowl, Nana’s bread that comes with a savory carrot dip (both are divine), the yucca puffs with hot sauce, and dragonfruit lemonade. All were great. Do yourself a favor and check this place out.
Rice is culture
I enjoyed the shrimp bowl and will be back for the chicken
I frequent with Field Trip at least 3-4 times a week. The customer service is Excellent and the food is Amazing! I recommend the wok veggies, the crispy chicken, NaN  bread 😮 and the black rice.

I was soooo excited to try this place. Im obsessed with Chef JJ's work and I love his concept for this restaurant. Unfortunately there was way too much fat in my rice bowl. The roti/mama's bread was sooooo good. I will give FieldTrip another chance, but my first impression was just ok.
Chef JJ is incredibly talented and bringing high caliber foods to Harlem again. Everything was delicious and affordable. The staff were very friendly. If only we didn't live in Queens!
Everything was fresh and the staff was super friendly.... I had the Baby Spinach bowl and it just did not seem to have a lot of flavor...none actually.  However the crab wontons were excellent!
Very tasty
Dishes are serve quick, delicious and healthy.  Hopefully recommend!!!
Went here last night and it was delicious! So happy to have Field Trip in the neighborhood, and they deliver - AWESOME.

This food is average at best.  It’s been compared to home cooked food by some reviewers which is not entirely inaccurate, but it just doesn’t rise to the level of restaurant quality.  Seriously, you could make this at home.  Mushy mixed vegetables that are supposed to have broccoli and greens but have only broccoli stems and green stems, clumpy, poorly prepared—bland—rice, and small quantities of food atop the rice.  I will say that the three shrimp I. The “shrimp bowl” (yes that’s accurate, 3) were well prepared, as was the more generous portion of braised beef.  But that is all the praise I can give.  This restaurant really needs to up the quality of preparation if it is to survives selling 12 - 15-dollar rice bowls

Food, excellent. Great quality, delicious, filling. Dragon fruit lemonade went well with the shrimp bowl. Staff, super friendly and accommodating, worth the trip to say hello. Only qualm, 3 shrimp? We're not talking jumbo, maybe medium at best. I wasn't expecting 10 but 5 might have fit the bowl and rounded out the bites better.  I'll definitely return and try other dishes. It's worth testing other bowls.

Had the Shrimp Bowl, Salmon Bowl, Veggie Bowl, and side veggies. Everything was so good!! I would’ve like it to be a little hotter in temperature though - it had cooled down quite a bit when I got it. The service/employees were quite friendly and knowledgeable. Go early because they run out of things quickly as it’s all very fresh :)

Very Hip vibe and nice spot to chill. The veggie rice bowl was my favorite. The portion was plentiful and full of flavor. Multi-layered textures and a combination of sweet, spicy and savory flavors. Basmati rice, naan bread, peppers veggies with a little beet hot sauce was on point. Staff friendly and service was quick. Looking forward to going back
A great place for a realy good meal
I had the beef bowl, the shrimp bowl the crab dumplings. It was like eating home made food. Doesn't get better than THAT! The prices were very reasonable for NYC too. Its a win, win situation.
I thought I liked the beef bowl best then I had the quinoa  and now I can’t decide! I also loved the ale that is made in Harlem. Will definitely return for the friendly cool vibe.

The shrimp bowl was delicious. It was drawn to it because It had sticky rice and green curry and toasted coconut. Stick rive was flavorful and green curry complemented the subtle sweetness of the rice. I loved the lemonade it was Tart and not too sweet which I really appreciate. Will be back soon to try other bowls and the bao
Fantastic food, great vibe, awesome for families!
Omg. $6 rose that tastes like heaven. What?!?!?! The spot is super hip too. Neon signs that light up your soul.
Great food, really affordable... Loved the rose!
This place is amazing!! From when you walk to a cheerful staff and comfortable environment definitely check this new spot out one of my Favs already.
